facts.text: Gandhi came to India in 1915.
He followed the doctrine of Ahimsa.
The Champaran Satyagraha in 1917 was his first success in India.
The Ahmedabad Satyagraha led to a 35 per cent increase in wages.
Kheda Satyagraha was a protest against land revenue.
Gandhi was given the title Mahatma by Rabindranath Tagore in 1917.
He was also called Malang Baba/Nanga Fakir.
Gandhi's birth name was Mohan Das Karam Chand Gandhi.
He was influenced by John Ruskin, Leo Tolstoy, Thoreau, Emerson, the Bible, and the Gita.
Gandhi's literary works include 'Hind Swaraj' and 'My Experiments with Truth'.
He was known as Rashtrapita by Subhash Chandra Bose.
Gandhi was assassinated on January 30, 1948.
Gandhi was born on October 2, 1869, in Porbandar, Gujarat.
His father's name was Karam Chand Gandhi.
His mother's name was Putali Bai.
Gopal Krishna Gokhale was his political guru.
Mahadev Desai served as his private secretary.
Gandhi edited several newspapers including Indian Opinion and Harijan.
Gandhi's titles include 'Half Naked Saint' and 'Indian/Traitor Faqir'.
Franq Mores called him 'Half Naked Saint'.
Winston Churchill referred to him as 'Indian/Traitor Faqir'.
He was awarded the title Rashtrapita by Subhash Chandra Bose in 1944.
Sarojini Naidu was known as the Nightingale of India.
She was married to Dr. Govindarajulu Naidu.
Under the guidance of Gopal Krishna Gokhale, she became the first woman to participate in India’s struggle for independence.
She presided over the Kanpur Session of Congress in 1925.
She was the first woman to become the Governor of Uttar Pradesh.
Her famous books include 'The Golden Threshold', 'The Feather of the Dawn', and 'The Broken Wing'.
Rajagopalachari was a politician and lawyer from Tamil Nadu.
He started the Civil Disobedience Movement in Tamil Nadu.
He served as the Chief Minister of Madras in 1937.
He founded the Swatantra Party in 1959.
He was awarded the Bharat Ratna in 1954.
He founded the National College at Patna.
He was elected as the President of the Constituent Assembly.
He became the first President of the Indian Republic.
He was honoured with Bharat Ratna in 1962.
He edited the newspaper 'Desh'.
Nehru became the General Secretary of the Indian National Congress in 1928.
He was the first Prime Minister of Republic India.
He authored the Doctrine of Panchseel.
His autobiography was entitled 'Autobiography'.
He participated in all the Three Round Table Conferences of London.
He was in the Governor-General’s Executive Council from 1942 to 1946.
He started The Republican Party in 1956.
He embraced Buddhism towards the end of his life.
He founded the independence for India League with Jawaharlal Nehru.
He was elected as the President of INC at its Haripura Session (1938) and Tripuri Session (1939).
He supposedly died in a plane crash in 1945.
He gave the famous slogans 'Dilli Chalo' and 'Jai Hind'.
He was a member of Hindustan Socialist Republican Association.
He was involved in the Lahore Conspiracy.
He was executed on 23rd March, 1931.
